articles.content:
Greetings to Nigerian President 
    Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on May 2 sent a message of greetings to Olusegun Obasanjo upon his reelection as President of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.
 His reelection is an expression of the deep trust and expectation of the Nigerian government and people, the message said.    
 It expressed belief that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation existing between the two countries would grow stronger and wished him greater success in his work.

articles.content:
Anecdote about Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave on-the-spot guidance to the newly built syringe factory on December 19, Juche 89 (2000).
 After looking round its production processes, he said he would take some injectors produced there for test use.    
 A few days later, he met an official and told him that he had got injections with the syringes and some of them had pained him. And he said that the pain might be caused by needles, so efforts should be directed to improving the quality of needles for people and servicemen.

Greetings to Polish Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to his Polish counterpart Wlodzimierz Cimoszewicz on the occasion of the constitutional day, a national holiday of the Polish people.
 In the message Paek wished the polish foreign minister success in his work for Poland's admission to the European Union and hoped that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would further develop.
